results.title: Coelenterates (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Biomedia Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Focuses on a hydra capturing a daphnia. Compares the reproduction methods of the hydra and obelia. Shows closeups of the physalia and limestone producing polyps in stony corals. Written and photographed by Bruce J. Russell.

results.title: The Flatworms (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell and Modern Learning Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Shows planarian’s moving and detecting food; the taking of food into the branched intestine through a muscular pharynx. One animal is shown regenerating new parts. The microscope reveals tapeworms in a catfish. A living scolex is shown clinging to the intestinal wall. Several proglottids are shown in detail.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce J. Russell and Modern Learning Aids

results.title: A New look at Leeuwenhoek's wee beasties
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell and Biomedia Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of the Series “Inhabitants of the planet earth”
Examines free-living protists as viewed in natural time by differential interference cinemicrography. Discusses the classification and general characteristics of flagellates, amoebas, and ciliates.

results.title: Protist physiology (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Examines the internal processes of independently living cells, including mechanisms for phagocytosis and digestion, and for saprozoic and autotrophic nutrition. Describes symbiotic associations between autotrophs and heterotrophs and methods of water balance.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Examines the internal processes of independently living cells, including mechanisms for phagocytosis and digestion, and for saprozoic and autotrophic nutrition. Describes symbiotic associations between autotrophs and heterotrophs and methods of water balance.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Examines the internal processes of independently living cells, including mechanisms for phagocytosis and digestion, and for saprozoic and autotrophic nutrition. Describes symbiotic associations between autotrophs and heterotrophs and methods of water balance.

results.title: Protist ecology (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Discusses the vital role played by protists in the ecology of the planet Earth. Examines the commensal, parasitic, and mutualistic life styles practiced by a large number of protist species.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Discusses the vital role played by protists in the ecology of the planet Earth. Examines the commensal, parasitic, and mutualistic life styles practiced by a large number of protist species.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Discusses the vital role played by protists in the ecology of the planet Earth. Examines the commensal, parasitic, and mutualistic life styles practiced by a large number of protist species.

results.title: Annelids (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell, Modern Learning Aids and Biomedia Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
A small anaesthetised earthworm is shown dissected, featuring the pumping heart. Shows peristaltic contractions which mix the food and send it along the intestinal tract. Undigested “castings” are expelled and their importance in soil ecology is discussed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce J. Russell, Modern Learning Aids and Biomedia Associates

results.title: My beach
results.creator_credit: Richard Sagigi, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Life, for Richard Sagigi, was never always easy. Times at school when he was getting into trouble forced him to move to another school. But he knows that he can reconnect with himself on the beach where his family live, digging for turtle eggs, learning about animal conservation and meeting people from different cultures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Sagigi, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Physical facilities
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
Describes the steps in organising physical facilities of a new enterprise: 1) location from the aspect of available facilities; 2) type of building suited to the enterprise; 3) the arrangement and position of the buildings; 4) plant layout from the aspect of type production.

results.title: Step by step
results.creator_credit: Sam Kluk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sam Kluk loved his beautiful town of Kuranda in Northern Queensland. Unfortunately, there was another side to the quiet town and Kluk was determined to take every opportunity to escape it.
